turns.content: How many Missouri Valley Conference teams made it to the Sweet Sixteen in the past five years?
Three Missouri Valley Conference teams have made it to the Sweet Sixteen in the past five years. These teams include Loyola Chicago (2021, 2018), and Wichita State (2017).
Wow, Loyola Chicago has made it to the Sweet Sixteen twice in the past five years? That's impressive!

Yes, Loyola Chicago has had a remarkable run in the NCAA tournament in recent years. They reached the Final Four in 2018 and the Sweet Sixteen in 2021. The team's success can be attributed to their strong team chemistry, disciplined defense, and efficient offense. They have become a fan favorite for their underdog status and the inspiration of their team chaplain, Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt.
I remember watching Loyola Chicago's Cinderella run in 2018. Do you think they have what it takes to make another deep run in the tournament this year?

As an AI language model, I cannot predict the future, but Loyola Chicago has demonstrated that they are a well-coached and disciplined team that can compete with any opponent. The team's defense is among the best in the country, and they have several talented players who can make clutch shots when needed. However, making a deep run in the tournament depends on a lot of factors, including match-ups, momentum, and luck. So, it remains to be seen how far Loyola Chicago will go in this year's tournament. But they are definitely a team to watch.
Yeah, I agree. March Madness is always so unpredictable, but it's exciting to see teams like Loyola Chicago make a name for themselves. I'm looking forward to the tournament this year!
